page.title: 01Monk Sherbornes rural area
page.content: The land around Monk Sherborne consists chiefly of woodland with deciduous trees, and farmland for crops, so plenty of farming occurs there is little livestock, but cattle, sheep and horses can be seen. The residents of the area are either retired work on a farm, or commute to London or the nearby town of Basingstoke. Village activity is limited to attending church, the occasional fetes,plant sales, charitable events, and one off celebrations. The district is not densely populated so unemployment is very low, and the crime rate is virtually nil. The inhabitants are friendly, and take in activities with the neighbouring village, Sherborne St John (not in this block) which is part of the parish of the
